content.description: Two 95 percent confidence intervals will be constructed to estimate the difference in means of two populations, R and J. One confidence interval, <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, will be constructed using samples of size 400 from each of R and J, and the other confidence interval, <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, will be constructed using samples of size 100 from each of R and J.
content.question: When all other things remain the same, which of the following describes the relationship between the two confidence intervals?

choices.label: The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be 4 times the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be 2 times the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal to the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one half " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> times the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one fourth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> times the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The width of <math alttext="I sub 400 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one half " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> times the width of <math alttext="I sub 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.7: Justifying a Claim About the Difference of Two Means Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
